sub_title: Cross-Disciplinary University Lecturer for Environmental Economics, International Law & Social Psychology | Consultant, Author and Public Speaker | Multi-Potentiate Synergist
summary:
Chad Patrick Osorio is an international academic, lawyer and economist advocating for human and environmental rights.

Chad is current Sandwich PhD candidate at Wageningen University and Research, the Netherlands, under the Environmental Economics and Natural Resources (ENR) and LAW Chair Groups. As a full scholar of the French government, Chad graduated at the top of his class with a Master II Business, Law and Economics from L'Université d'Aix-Marseille, mention très bien. He received a Juris Doctor & a BA Psychology degree, cum laude, from the University of the Philippines Diliman. 

Chad won 1st place in the Professional Category of  the Peter Drucker Challenge 2022, invited on an all-expense paid trip to Vienna, Austria to receive the award. He was also finalist of the same competition in 2020 in the student division. In 2017, he was hailed as the first Filipino recipient of the Eisaku Sato Award for Brilliance, a global essay competition supported by the United Nations University and Prime Minister Sato’s Nobel Peace Prize. He is contributing author to a number of int'l publications, including the Asia-Pacific Yearbook of International Humanitarian Law and the Palgrave Encyclopaedia of Global Security Studies.

Chad has been invited to speak at various int'l events, notably for the Int'l Conference on Human Rights and Peace & Conflict (Thailand), ASEAN Youth Leaders' Ass'n (Viet Nam), & Asian Development Bank (Japan), among many others. He has given guest lectures for the PH's top higher education institutions.

Chad has been awarded the 2015 Gawad Felicisimo T. San Luis for the Most Outstanding Youth of Laguna & the 2018 Huwarang Kabataang Lumbeño (Exemplary Youth Award).  He is also an int'l award-winning photographer, his works on exhibit at Harvard Law School, as well as at the 2017 UN Conference of Parties in Bonn, Germany, among others. 

In 2022, Chad was named Global AI Ambassador by SwissCognitive, World-Leading AI Network. At the same time, he teaches university and training courses on International Law, Intermediate Economics, Criminal Psychology, and Legal Terminology, among others. 

He devotes his spare time volunteering in underserved, underprivileged communities.
